Module runs ileapp program correctly

format files and remove commented code

format files and remove commented code

nodes.bodyText: I think this is cut and paste error.
Is this check necessary? I think you can just let the for loop recognize there is nothing to process.
I think you can remove this comment, assuming you did change it
The first condition should check not empty.

You also need to catch UncheckedIOException, a runtime wrapper for IOException. The IOException caught here, according to the Files.walk documentation, is just related to accessing the iLeappOutputDir. If there is a problem while iterating, then UncheckedIOException will be thrown. Checked exception support was never worked into Java 8 streams and lambdas. You can log the underlying IOException by calling ex.getCause() or something like that.
See previous comments on Files.walk() in the ingest module, UncheckedIOException should be caught here too.
